intro: Secamone glabra, commonly known as white secamone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in rocky soils or along coastal areas. The plant is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
